physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Bilateral scapholunate dissociation; no significant clinical findings.
Mild intermittent pain, no new symptoms, no change in activity.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Pain resolved spontaneously after initial complaint; no clinical or radiographic deterioration.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Pain and weakness bilaterally, more severe on right; intermittent clicking sensation on right.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Symptoms aggravated by lifting; no subjective worsening.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Physical examination showed no wrist instability; mild limitation of wrist motion.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Continued to show mild pain and left wrist popping sensations at follow-up 13 months later.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: No symptoms or weakness; full range of motion.
Mild wrist pain with twisting and lifting; no new symptoms.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Slight worsening reported on one side; no need for activity change.
